abstract.p: Ethiopian fighter planes bomb airport in Asmara, Eritrea, taking aim at military airstrip in first air raid on Eritrea's capital since opening blows of war between two nations in 1998 (S)

block.p: Ethiopian fighter planes bombed the airport here today, taking aim at a military airstrip in the first air raid on Eritrea's capital since the opening blows of the war between the two nations in 1998.
The raid was carried out even as the nations' foreign ministers prepared to open a new round of peace talks in Algeria.

Ethiopian fighter planes bombed the airport here today, taking aim at a military airstrip in the first air raid on Eritrea's capital since the opening blows of the war between the two nations in 1998.
The raid was carried out even as the nations' foreign ministers prepared to open a new round of peace talks in Algeria.

No one was killed in the attack, just three miles from the capital, though officials here said two civilians were wounded. Four Ethiopian MIG-23's dropped the bombs this morning on the military section of the airport, which also handles civilian traffic. One bomb apparently hit a guard tower, but most seemed to have landed in the grass, setting off brush fires. At least one bomb hit the road to the city. Two Eritrean MIG-29's at the airport were undamaged and chased the Ethiopian planes, officials said.
